Narrativa gerada: ConceptMap ConceptMapCGMToOMOP

Mapeamento de (não especificado) para (não especificado)


Grupo 1 Mapeamento de Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC) to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
2345-7 (Glucose [Mass/volume] in Serum or Plasma)is equivalent to3004501 (Glucose [Mass/volume] in Serum or Plasma)VERIFIED OMOP mapping for blood glucose. - OMOP concept_id: 3004501 - Domain: Measurement - Use for CGM readings with measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707 - Unit_concept_id: 8840 (mg/dL) or 8753 (mmol/L)
97507-8 (Glucose management indicator)(not mapped)GMI (formerly eA1C) estimates HbA1c from CGM data. Formula: GMI (%) = 3.31 + 0.02392 × [mean glucose in mg/dL] Clinical significance: Allows real-time A1c estimation without blood draw. GAP: No OMOP concept exists for GMI.
41653-7 (Glucose [Mass/volume] mean in Serum or Plasma)(not mapped)Mean glucose over CGM recording period. Use measurement_source_value for context.

Grupo 2 Mapeamento de CGM Metrics CodeSystem to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
tir (Time in Range (70-180 mg/dL))(not mapped)CRITICAL GAP: TIR (Time in Range) has NO OMOP concept. - Target: >70% per International Consensus 2019 - Unit: percentage (%) - Most important CGM metric for clinical outcomes Workaround: Store in measurement_source_value = 'TIR:{value}%'
tbr-l1 (Time Below Range Level 1 (54-69 mg/dL))(not mapped)Target: <4% per International Consensus. Hypoglycemia Level 1.
tbr-l2 (Time Below Range Level 2 (<54 mg/dL))(not mapped)Target: <1% per International Consensus. Clinically significant hypoglycemia.
tar-l1 (Time Above Range Level 1 (181-250 mg/dL))(not mapped)Target: <25% per International Consensus. Hyperglycemia Level 1.
tar-l2 (Time Above Range Level 2 (>250 mg/dL))(not mapped)Target: <5% per International Consensus. Clinically significant hyperglycemia.
cv (Coefficient of Variation (%))(not mapped)CV = (SD / Mean) × 100 Target: <36% indicates stable glycemia (Monnier et al.) Critical for glycemic variability assessment.
sd (Standard Deviation)(not mapped)Glucose standard deviation. Unit: mg/dL or mmol/L.

name: ConceptMapCGMToOMOP
title: CGM Metrics to OMOP CDM Mapping
description:
Maps Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) metrics to OMOP CDM concepts for federated analytics.

International Consensus on Time in Range (Battelino et al., Diabetes Care 2019):
- TIR (Time in Range 70-180 mg/dL): Target >70% for most patients
- TBR-L1 (54-69 mg/dL): <4% target
- TBR-L2 (<54 mg/dL): <1% target
- TAR-L1 (181-250 mg/dL): <25% target
- TAR-L2 (>250 mg/dL): <5% target
- CV (Coefficient of Variation): <36% indicates stable glycemia

Target OMOP Table: MEASUREMENT
- measurement_concept_id: mapped OMOP concept
- value_as_number: CGM metric value
- unit_concept_id: 8840 (mg/dL) or 8753 (mmol/L)
- measurement_type_concept_id: 44818707 (Patient self-reported/device)

Supported CGM Systems:
- Dexcom G6/G7, Stelo (consumer)
- Abbott Libre 2/3
- Medtronic Guardian
- Consumer metabolic monitors (Levels, January AI)
purpose: Enable ETL transformation of CGM data from FHIR to OMOP CDM for participation in OHDSI federated research networks, diabetes registries, and metabolic health research.

target.comment:
VERIFIED OMOP mapping for blood glucose.
- OMOP concept_id: 3004501
- Domain: Measurement
- Use for CGM readings with measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707
- Unit_concept_id: 8840 (mg/dL) or 8753 (mmol/L)

GMI (formerly eA1C) estimates HbA1c from CGM data.
Formula: GMI (%) = 3.31 + 0.02392 × [mean glucose in mg/dL]
Clinical significance: Allows real-time A1c estimation without blood draw.
GAP: No OMOP concept exists for GMI.

element.display: Glucose [Mass/volume] mean in Serum or Plasma

target.comment: Mean glucose over CGM recording period. Use measurement_source_value for context.

unmapped.display: No OMOP concept - requires custom vocabulary extension

target.comment:
CRITICAL GAP: TIR (Time in Range) has NO OMOP concept.
- Target: >70% per International Consensus 2019
- Unit: percentage (%)
- Most important CGM metric for clinical outcomes
Workaround: Store in measurement_source_value = 'TIR:{value}%'
Target: <4% per International Consensus. Hypoglycemia Level 1.
Target: <1% per International Consensus. Clinically significant hypoglycemia.
Target: <25% per International Consensus. Hyperglycemia Level 1.
Target: <5% per International Consensus. Clinically significant hyperglycemia.

CV = (SD / Mean) × 100
Target: <36% indicates stable glycemia (Monnier et al.)
Critical for glycemic variability assessment.
Glucose standard deviation. Unit: mg/dL or mmol/L.

unmapped.display: No OMOP concept - International Consensus 2019 metrics not yet in OMOP
